intro: Cnestis lasiocarpa, commonly known as the rough-hairy cnestis, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, stiff hairs, giving it a rough texture. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with ray florets surrounding a central disk of tubular flowers. Cnestis lasiocarpa is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
